intro: Fagonia longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-pedicellate fagonia, is a shrub belonging to the family Capparaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Fagonia longipedicellata is often found in coastal and inland desert environments.
